name: lodash
description: Lodash is a multi-purpose utility library for JavaScript.

name: moment
description: Moment is a library for parsing, validating, manipulating, and formatting dates.

name: numeral
description: Numeral is a Javascript library for formatting and manipulating numbers.

name: highcharts
description: Highcharts is a commercial Javascript charting library, used heavily in SQL Monitor.

name: underscore
description: Underscore is a multi-purpose utility library for Javascript. We prefer lodash.

name: day.js
description: Day.js is a trivially-small date library, and an alternative to moment.js. Being explored by CoreDev.

name: Monaco Editor
description: Monaco is the editor behind VS Code, available as a library for applications. It provides a code editor with completion/highlighting and a diff viewer. Currently being explored by Team Orca for editing/viewing migration scripts.

name: jscookie
description: Jscookie is a lightweight JavaScript API for handling browser cookies.

name: fetch
description: Fetch enables use of the fetch standard for request/response inside a web browser.

name: axios
description: Axios is a promise-based HTTP client. We only use this when there is a requirement to support IE9/10.

name: CommandLineParser
description: CommandLineParser is a more modern commandline parser, which makes it easy to split a commandline up into multiple 'verbs'. Currently being explored by Team Orca.

name: RedGate.Legacy.CommandLine
description: RedGate.Legacy.CommandLine is the old commandline parsing logic split out of Shared Utils. It's still used by a few products, but better libraries should be used for new development

name: A placeholder
description: A placeholder so we have 4 quadrants

name: Dapper
description: Dapper is a .Net object mapper that extends IDbConnection. It has no database-specific implementation details.

name: Hangfire
description: Hangfire is a library to perform background processing in .NET and .NET Core applications.

name: Autofac
description: Autofac is an Inversion of Control container for .NET Core, ASP.NET Core, .NET 4.5.1+ and our preferred IoC container choice. Autofac allows you to register components and express dependencies through its flexible module system and simple extension points.

name: Ninject
description: Ninject is a dependency injector for .NET applications. However, Autofac is our preferred IoC container.

name: FsCheck
description: FsCheck is a framework for property-based testing.

name: NSubsitute
description: NSubstitute is our default mocking library of choice. We feel it's got less setup cost than Moq and requires fewer .Object calls.

name: Moq
description: Moq is a great framework for mocking, but we prefer NSubstitute's simplicity. We see no benefit in having a common mocking framework across solutions.

name: SeriLog
description: Serilog is our preferred logging framework. It's well maintained, supports structured event data and is portable between .NET platforms.

name: SignalR
description: SignalR allows server code to send asynchronous notifications to client-side web applications.

name: Knockout.js
description: Knockout is a minimilast library for binding data to web views. We prefer React now though existing usages of knockout.js are fine.

name: JQuery
description: Modern browsers and advances in JavaScript means we don't get value by using jQuery any more.

name: RedGate.Legacy.*
description: We have a collection of old technologies in the 'RedGate.Legacy' packages, as the name suggests these are old and should not be adopted. But moving away from them can be expensive so we don't think its worth the cost.

name: DotNetZip
description: DotNetZip is an opensource .NET library for handling ZIP files. We prefer the capabilities provided by the .Net framework in System.IO.Compression.

name: 7Zip
description: 7Zip is an open source file archiver and compression tool. We prefer the capabilities provided by the .Net framework in System.IO.Compression.

name: System.IO.Compression
description: System.IO.Compression is the .Net Framework/Core provided set of compression and decompression services for streams.

name: NSwag
description: An implementation of the Open API specification currently being explored by the Data Catalog team.

name: Swashbuckle
description: An implementation of the Open API specification currently being explored by the Versioning teams for providing the out-of-process APIs.

name: FluentAssertions
description: FluentAssertions is an assertion framework that allow you to more naturally specify the expected outcome of a TDD or BDD-style unit tests. Much more readable than Assert.That().

name: Shoudly
description: Shouldly is an assertion framework similar to FluentAssertions. We decided to adopt the latter.

name: Task Parallel Library (TPL)
description: The Task Parallel Library (TPL) is a System.Threading a backport library for .NET Framework 3.5. Since we should be adopting .Net Framework 4.7+/.Net Core everywhere, there is no a need for TPL as an extra dependency.

name: Rhino Mocks
description: Rhino Mocks is no longer actively maintained, nor does it support .NET Core / .NET Standard. We have some tests that use RhinoMocks. While we shouldn't write any more, we have no plans to actively replace these uses.

name: Log4Net
description: Log4Net is no longer actively maintained. We've also had problems with our use of it by having a single static root. We don't recommend this for new applications, but can tolerate existing usages.

name: NetArchTest
description: The NetArchTest is a fluent API for .NET that can enforce architectural rules in unit tests. Currently explored by the Data Catalog team.
